column2: Sunshine, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am taking Lamictal 150 mg to treat depression. It took almost 4-6 weeks for me to feel the effects. That was such a relief. I was on Zoloft few years ago, and I loved it too. I was so worried when I read the sideeffects of Lamictal especially those related to the rash, so i used to check my whole body for rash everyday. I frove my brother and BF crazy:) after a while i stopped doing that, but today I had a very bad allergic reaction on my face, arms and hands, and when I called the doctor he informed me that there was an interaction between Lamictal and Tylanol. After two hours I was back to normal. The doctor advised me to wait 2-4 hours between both. Best of luck for everyone. I'm so glad I am feeling MUCH better than few months ago..

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: At the end of the orange kit and my racing thoughts have subsided so that I can think clearly. I have experienced insomnia and shortness of breath quite frequently. The agitation has also increased so DR is adding a new med to my list. I will stay on it a little longer to see if the combo of drugs will help the effectiveness. Just be careful about the rash. I did get a rash each time the dose was doubled. Both times happened about 2-4 days following the double dose. It was on both of my forearms and itched like crazy but went away in 2 hours. Pharmacist said that as long as it didn't hurt and no other side effects (fever, etc) then I was OK. Just be careful and always let a pharmacist or your doctor know if you get the rash no matter how small it may be.

column9: I was taking Lexapro for the last year and a half and over the last month my family and friends were begging me to go to my dr. the lexapro had stopped working for me. i have manic episodes and swing into a sadness (NOT suicidal). mostly manic phases and LOTS of anxiety. so i went and she put me on lamictal. i've been on it for 3 days and i'm still "high as a kite" flying around my house getting stuff done, figity. i personaly don't think it's working for me. on top of that i now have extremely dark urine. which is a "go to your dr. immediately" side effect. soooo, i'm going back to the dr on monday to check in and figure out what the hell is going on. but basically i don't think it's working for me.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Lamictal has worked for me fairly well.  The first 2 months I took it by itself and it made my mood swing uncontrollable but always depressed.  I would begin to cry for no reason.  My doctor put me back on my Celexa 20mg and I've been fine for about 2 years.  I know it is working because every couple of months I decide to just stop taking all my meds!  Lamictal is not the best drug for someone like me because after 5 days without it you have to start all over with 25mg a day for two weeks, 50mg..... until you get back to your level.  My level is 300mg a day so it takes me 6-7 weeks to recover from my mistake.  I experience mania, which I really enjoy, for a few weeks.I have also found that Lamictal and Birth Control pills do not mix.  I only take the Birth Control to stop my periods.  I take active pills continuouly.  I do not know if they are working against pregnancy!!!

column2: twinsbb1931, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I want to let everyone know that I've been on Cymbalta,Wellbutrin for about 3 yrs. They have worked together very well for awhile. But after about 6mos. I started feeling like I was going out of my mind,I started getting very sad, angery for no reason.It got to be so bad I wanted to go scrach someones eyes out I hated my life and others. So,about 4 weeks ago I went to my Dr. and she gave me a LAMICTAL pack to try. It's been great after that,Thank God for that treatment.(My family was about to ship my off to a padded room.) So, I would like to tell anyone that is going though this,PLEASE check with your Dr. and see if this medication will work for you or your living with someone going though this.Please... get help!!! life is too short already, Plus.. AND GOD BLESS                     JESSIE from Arizona
